subclass.name: Broken Mind Domain
subclassFeatures: Channel Divinity: Realm of Madness|Cleric||Broken Mind|Nuaria|2

subclassFeature.name: Broken Mind Domain
entries: Life. It doesn’t have an intrinsic meaning. Randomness, luck, destiny, free will are all expressions of the same concept. Will you try to control that which is uncontrollable or tame the beast that rides its master and fail constantly? Or will you leave it all to chance and leave to the fullest? Daasis knows, and Daasis will provide.
At each indicated cleric level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: The Toll of Knowledge
entries: Your mind is broken and impossible to understand. To the outsider, you seem crazy and full of madness. In reality, you’re constantly trying to understand the meaning of everything and nothing while trying not to lose your mind in the process.

At 1st level, Your mind can’t be read or detected, creatures can’t telepathically communicate with you unless you allow it, and you have advantage on saving throws against any effect that would determine whether you are telling the truth.

Roll or choose a madness from the {@table indefinite madness} table. It cannot be cured less of a {@spell wish} spell. Additionally, choose between the {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History} or {@skill Religion} skills. You can roll with advantage the chosen skill. You must finish a short rest to benefit from this feature again.
At 8th level you also become immune to the charmed condition.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Realm of Madness
entries: At 2nd level, you can use your channel divinity to create a space to treat creatures according to their mental well-being.

As an action, you present your holy symbol, and a sphere of a purple colour emanates from you. The sphere is centered on you, has a 30-foot radius, and is filled with dim purple light. The sphere moves with you, and it lasts for 1 minute or until you are incapacitated or die. Whenever a creature (including you) is in the sphere, they get one of these effects:

items: If you see the creature as friendly, they get advantage on Wisdom saving throws or saving throws that would make them charmed or frightened, as long they are inside the sphere.

If you see the creature as an enemy, they get disadvantage on Wisdom saving throws that would make them {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}. In addition to that, you can try to damage your enemies’ minds. At the start of your turn, you can use your action to deal psychic damage to hostile creatures inside your sphere’s aura. They must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d6 + your Cleric level psychic damage. Constructs and undeads automatically succeed this saving throw.

subclassFeature.name: A Mightier Mind
entries: At 6th level, if you get hit by an attack you can spend your reaction to try to force your attacker to target another creature instead of you. It must succeed on  a Wisdom saving throw or attack another creature within the reach of the attack. If two or more creatures are equally closer, the target is chosen at random. If there are no other possible targets, the attacker doesn’t attack and loses its action.
You cannot use this feature again until you finish a short rest.

subclassFeature.name: Potent Spellcasting
entries: Starting at 8th level, you add your Wisdom modifier to the damage you deal with any cleric cantrip.

subclassFeature.name: Mind Shatter
entries: You can share a glimpse of your perception of reality with a creature, which probably will break its mind

At 17th level, you can touch a creature. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw against your spellcasting DC or be {@condition incapacitated} for one minute or until you stop touching the creature. Additionally, it takes {@dice 2d8} psychic damage at the start of each of its turns. The creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.
You must finish a short rest before using this feature again.

subclassFeature.name: Dusk Domain
entries: As stated in the Glooming Letters, sometimes darkness must be fought with darkness and lies with lies.
At each indicated cleric level, you add the listed spells to your spells prepared.

subclassFeature.name: Charming Lies
entries: You can use words to convince enemies that you are more of an ally than an enemy.

At 1st level, when a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see hits you with an attack, you can use your reaction to cause the creature to make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, the creature is {@condition charmed} by you until the end of its next turn or until it takes damage. Creatures  are immune to this effect if they don't share a language with you or if they have already been charmed by you in this way within the last 24 hours.
You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Wisdom modifier. You regain all expended uses when you finish a long rest.
Also at 1st level, you are proficient with the {@skill deception} skill and the {@skill performance}.

subclassFeature.name: Channel Divinity: Betrayal
entries: Starting at 2nd level, you can use your Channel Divinity to backstab those who were foolish enough to trust you.
When you roll damage against a creature that is {@condition charmed} by you, you can use your Channel Divinity to deal maximum damage, instead of rolling.

subclassFeature.name: Foul play
entries: You know how to strike an enemy by using nasty tricks.
At 6th level, when you have advantage on attack rolls against a creature and take the Attack action, you can use you bonus action to make an additional attack.

subclassFeature.name: Divine Strike
entries: At 8th level, the cleric gains the ability to infuse his or her weapon strikes with divine poison. Once on each of the cleric's turns when he or she hits a creature with a weapon attack, the cleric can cause the attack to deal an extra 1d8 poison damage to the target. When the cleric reaches 14th level, the extra damage increases to 2d8.

subclassFeature.name: Master of Treason
entries: You are an expert at foul playing and keeping the trust from your enemies at the same time.

At 17th level, you have advantage on attack rolls against creatures who are {@condition charmed} by you. Additionally, when a creature is {@condition charmed} by you, the charmed effect does not end as a result of that creature taking damage.
